section.title: Asset Management
section.para: To configure asset management, go to Accounting > Setup > Configure > Asset Management. The following screen will appear:

Configure Asset Management
The Asset Management screen includes the following options:

listitem.para: The number of an upcoming maintenance order will be in this field.

When a company has assets that come from sources outside its usual profits (i.e. selling a machine such as a copier or a forklift used), that profit will be listed in the maintenance parts expense. The Maintenance Parts Expense section lists the options that control where the charge for maintenance parts and other related miscellaneous charges gets assigned to.
Select to add maintenance parts expenses to the item cost category.

varlistentry.term: Use Item Cost Category Expense (with Manual Override)

listitem.para: Select to add maintenance parts expenses to the item cost category, with the option to change the cost category per maintenance order.
Select to use and set the default expense category for the system.

Click on the magnifying glass icon to search through the expense categories in the database. The selected expense category will become the default expense category for the system. This field is only enabled when the Default Expense Category option is selected.

varlistentry.term: Create To Do items and alarms

listitem.para: Select this option to add maintenance orders as to-do items and to set an alarm for them as needed.
